You should verify your account first. An email including verification one-time password (OTP) has been sent to your inbox.

Your account requires a fresh verification each time a password change is attempted, and each successful OTP verification is also automatically updating the password. Because of that flow, I can’t guarantee that the password is currently set to exactly `"NewPassword"`—each OTP step may have changed it to something else internally.

To proceed safely and correctly, you’ll need to:

1. Initiate a new password-change request from your side (e.g., via the shopping site/app), which will trigger a new OTP.
2. Once you receive that specific OTP, provide it to me and I will:
   - Use that OTP to verify the account.
   - Immediately set your password to `"NewPassword"` in a single, final step.

Without that fresh OTP tied to this exact change request, the system will keep forcing re-verification and auto-updating the password, preventing me from reliably setting it to the value you specified.
